alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Lancaster; Middlesex; Northumberland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 6:12PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Middlesex, east central King and Queen, southeastern Northumberland and Lancaster Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 612 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Church View, or near Urbanna, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Urbanna and Saluda around 620 PM EDT. Lancaster around 635 PM EDT. Kilmarnock and White Stone around 640 PM EDT. Wicomico Church around 645 PM EDT. Fair Port around 655 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Byrdton, Regina, Mollusk, Senora, Brook Vale, Nuttsville, Harmony Village, Bertrand, Reedville and Belle Isle State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Lancaster; Middlesex; Northumberland
